More information:
Hi, I don't mean to be a pest.  Maybe this is something you guys are working on for 2.2 RC0.  But just in case you don't know, if I try to run a report from the API that contains a crosstab, I get the following error (nightly build from 5/15/07).


Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.ModuleHandle.findLevel(Ljava/lang/String;)Lorg/eclipse/birt/report/model/api/DesignElementHandle;
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.item.crosstab.core.re.CrosstabQueryHelper.addHierachyAggregateOn(CrosstabQueryHelper.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.item.crosstab.core.re.CrosstabQueryHelper.buildQuery(CrosstabQueryHelper.java:226)

	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.ir.ExtendedItemDesign.accept(ExtendedItemDesign.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.data.dte.ReportQueryBuilder.build(ReportQueryBuilder.java:242)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.data.dte.ReportQueryBuilder.build(ReportQueryBuilder.java:224)

	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.executor.ReportExecutor.execute(ReportExecutor.java:104)

Thanks.

the exception is thrown out from:

org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.ModuleHandle

Please try the latest build. I've check the 5.15 build, the ModuleHandle Does have the findLevel() method. But I think maybe there is problem for building. I will notice build team to check this problem. If you still encounter this problem please reopen this bug.  Thanks!
